flow.descriptionCdata:
4c6e9b93-0b6a-4665-99cb-86d12430d2fe.37066a4c-5543-4dcc-abdd-d96d9f374a9e.description=
This is an operation that does nothing, and can be used to display information to the user by editing the display tab. It can also be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs, and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
4c6e9b93-0b6a-4665-99cb-86d12430d2fe.3d1b4505-e206-400a-84ca-24803357b7bf.prompt=Select from vm platforms 4c6e9b93-0b6a-4665-99cb-86d12430d2fe.438a69ff-eb6d-49d7-8a4d-50f1f75f7cd8.description=
Retrieve information about a virtual machine or a group of virtual machines in a datacenter or host system (pipe-delimited). Retrieve each object one at a time from an initial search query ala SQL Query operation.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type.
hostSystem - Target virtual machine host system.
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
getDetailed - Retrieve detailed information?

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no more - there are no more results to retrieve.

Returns\:
vmInfo - Virtual machine information.
numberOfResults - Number of results from the query remaining to be retrieved.
returnResult - Virtual machine ID or operation results.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
4c6e9b93-0b6a-4665-99cb-86d12430d2fe.7320f778-2b0f-4030-ab8d-b7521d072fb2.description=
Flex up a VM to the specific CPU Memory and Disk that is requested.

Input Parameters\:
 serviceName -name of the service that will be created with this flow
 VCenterHost -  vCenter host to execute against
 VCenterUsername - vCenter username
 VCenterPassword - vCenter password.
 virtualMachine - This is the virtual machine that will be flexed.
 dataStore -  target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs
 hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs
 cpuCount - number of cpus the virtual machine should have.
 memSize - amount of memory the virtual machine should have.
 addDisk - whether or not disk should be added to the vm.

Responses\:
   success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0
   failure - otherwise

Result Fields\:
 NA
4c6e9b93-0b6a-4665-99cb-86d12430d2fe.a184eb68-c055-4a7e-bc24-f98edefbcf5d.description=
Flex up a VM to the specific CPU Memory and Disk that is requested.

Input Parameters\:
 serviceName -name of the service that will be created with this flow
 VCenterHost -  vCenter host to execute against
 VCenterUsername - vCenter username
 VCenterPassword - vCenter password.
 virtualMachine - This is the virtual machine that will be flexed.
 dataStore -  target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs
 hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs
 cpuCount - number of cpus the virtual machine should have.
 memSize - amount of memory the virtual machine should have.
 addDisk - whether or not disk should be added to the vm.

Responses\:
   success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0
   failure - otherwise

Result Fields\:
 NA
flow.name: VM_setCPUAndMemory
